intro: Oreobliton chenopodioides, commonly known as the desert goosefoot, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae, which includes many species adapted to dry environments. The plant typically grows as a low, sprawling shrub with small, fleshy leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, a characteristic known as monoecious. Oreobliton chenopodioides is well adapted to extreme conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
